isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 4: SUPPLEMENTAL DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - NO START - DRY RESERVOIR

svcproc.title: PROBABLE CAUSES
svcproc.para: To understand the cause of the no-start and identify the most probable cause to this problem it is critical to identify the failure mode.
The most likely cause is the lack of oil supply by the lube system.
"DID NOT START AND RESERVOIR WAS FOUND DRY"

Possibilities include reservoir leak down: Caused by a leaking check valve in the high pressure oil pump, porous oil reservoir, or reservoir pump down which occurs during cranking and no start conditions caused by CMP circuit or other electronic control circuit failures.
